intro: Gyptis pinnatifida, commonly known as the slenderleaf gyptis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are small and yellow, typically appearing in clusters, and it produces achenes as its seeds. Gyptis pinnatifida is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils, showing some adaptability to different environmental conditions.
